name: Sky is Arrows
description:
Welcome to Sky Is Arrows, a captivating and intricate fantasy world filled with heroes, epic battles, treacherous exploration, deadly traps, and the ever-looming threat of permanent death. Prepare yourself for a thrilling journey where you must marshal your armies, safeguard your castle against relentless attackers, and embark on a quest to empower your hero to unimaginable heights. Will you have what it takes to vanquish all who stand in your path?

Immerse yourself in a realm brimming with dark secrets and enigmatic locales. Each Act of the game is designed to offer a unique and unpredictable experience, ensuring that no playthrough is ever the same. Venture forth, for beyond the shadows lie ancient graveyards, mysterious shrines, and an array of enticing item and gold chests awaiting your discovery.

As you progress, your hero will grow in strength and prowess. Strategically allocate skill points to enhance your hero’s attributes, shaping them into a formidable warrior capable of decimating hordes of foes. Alternatively, focus on honing a particular spell to unearth its true potential, unleashing devastating powers that will leave your enemies in awe.

Beware, for the world of Sky Is Arrows is relentless. The challenge steadily intensifies over time, and as you push forward, the game grows increasingly difficult. Strengthen your hero to face the ultimate showdown against the formidable final boss or risk succumbing to the overwhelming onslaught of enemy heroes and their augmented armies.

name: USA Racer
description:
A clandestine group has been organizing illegal street races in the USA for more than 50 years. What started as a fun event has grown into an annual contest for cash and glory. Only six are given a chance to prove their worth.

US Racer contains 11 tracks in different locations across the USA. Players can race in cities such as Los Angeles, New York or Washington DC or can take part in a race through the Grand Canyon or Yellowstone. Next to Time Trial and Single Race, the Tournament is the main event. It has been split up in three sections: Park Trial, City Trial and US Race. After completing a section, the next one is opened up.

The tracks contain obstacles and jumps. Enemies will try to push other cars off the road, and the police also make an appearance. Scattered around the tracks are power-ups that repair the car, provide boost or cash. The money can be used to upgrade the car, repair it or buy boost prior to the race. After completing an entire tournament with a certain car, an alternate vehicle becomes available for that character.

In the Windows version two-player duels are available over LAN or TCP/IP. Players can either go head-to-head or play a game of Cop vs. Racer.

name: Project: Starfighter

name: Adventures in Math

Join Whit, Connie, and Eugene in a chase through abandoned mine-shafts and secret passageways where every turn holds another key to the Sword’s real power. It’s a fast-paced flight through dark tunnels—with virtue itself in the balance. PC and Mac compatible.

name: Friday: Death to Arthur Yahtzee
description:
This is graphical point-and-click adventure with simple original engine. The game, like most 3rd Person adventure games, consists of action buttons which you use to interact with your surrounding. Simple as it is, it has your standard Look, Use, Talk, Inventory features.

You are Arthur Yahtzee, a dole-bludger living in Los Angeles, who is credited with one major event - when the local Federal Research Institute started spawning hideous mutants, he single-handedly stopped them. Now, another branch of FRI in Chicago are spawning more mutants, and this time they're after YOU...

name: Nemo's Reef

Players Build their own reef in Nemo's Reef.

Nemo's Reef was a city-building release on iOS and Android based on the 2003 Disney/Pixar animated feature film, Finding Nemo. The app was released in tie-in with the 2012 home video re-release of Finding Nemo.

The game was officially removed on June 1, 2017 from application stores after it was announced that the game would be no longer available to download on May 31, 2017. The game's servers were permanently closed on June 30 on that same year, one year after the theatrical release of Finding Dory.

People can compete in local four-on-four team sub battles and go online to battle submariners from around the world (as long as each person downloads the game for him- or herself).

It was released on 2008, in two editions: limited and full edition. The game was also ported to NDS on June 25, 2009 and placed on the same cartridge as Fushigi Yuugi Genbu Kaiden: Kagami no Miko.

The game was announced on February 6, 2014 in the Dengeki PlayStation magazine. In addition to the PlayStation 3, Battride War II was released on the Wii U. More than 300 horses, which are randomly generated in polygon form using data inputted by the user, are featured in the game. The script for the game was written by Kenji Terada, who is known for his work as a scriptwriter for Final Fantasy I, Final Fantasy II, and Final Fantasy III on the Famicom.

The multiplayer had support for Microsoft's Internet Gaming Zone as well.

name: Wakusei Woodstock: Funky Horror Band
description:
Wakusei Woodstock: Funky Horror Band (惑星ウッドストック ファンキーホラーバンド) is an RPG for the Sega Mega-CD.

Wakusei Woodstock is based on a creation by Victor Musical Industries, in which six stop-motion cartoon aliens played music as part of a group known as the "Funky Horror Band". The band would release a small number of albums between 1990 and 1992.

name: Proxy Comics HD

description: Gensokyo no Nazo is a 2D action platformer released in 2012. Doors appeared all over Gensokyo, Reimu and Marisa set out to investigate.

name: VR Baseball 2000
description: The follow up to VR Sports first licensed baseball game.

name: Extreme Hangman 2
description: The sequel Extreme Hangman 2 boasts over 3000 words in 14 totally new categories, with 10 funny animations and 4 eye-catching backgrounds to choose from.

name: Daemon Vector
description: This action RPG features gothic-styled slashing combat as a sinister strain of the Black Plague has brought to life Medieval Europe's decaying dead. The story traces back to the 14th century when Marco Polo traveled to Europe from the Far East. A seal from ancient China was broken, awakening the monster within, which brought one of the darkest periods of the human history when Black Death covered Europe with horror. A terrible disaster without cause unveils the 3D action adventure of Daemon Vector. Choose from one of the many playable characters to battle against the the daemons that have escaped from the seal. There are more than 20 stages in 6 areas.

name: Bygg Bilar med Mulle Meck
description: You are playing as Mulle Meck. And your mission is to build cars from various parts and junk that you find and drive through the town and help the townsfolk along the way.

name: Bird Mania 3D Christmas
description: Mojo’s adventure continues on as he struggles through the harsh winter, by-passing Santa’s elves who are journeying around the globe to deliver gifts in time for Christmas. With a boost of Christmas spirit and Santa’s hat, Mojo is more determined than ever to reach his destination!

name: Magicoal
description:
The boy Rhun and the girl Melvy live in a quiet forest village, both studying the art of magic. They enjoy a peaceful life, learning the secrets of the spirits and magical creatures populating the area. But on one fateful night, everything changes. A horde of goblins invades the village, burning it down. And it looks like the local church is in cohorts with a powerful demon bent on destruction! Before the heroes can realize what is happening, they are forced to escape into the forest, with only their magical powers at their side...

Magicoal is a "pseudo-RPG", i.e. an action-adventure with some minor RPG elements (money, items, etc.), but without an experience system of any kind. It can be played in two-player cooperative mode, controlling Rhun and Melvy, or as a single-player game, choosing one of them and letting the computer AI control the other. The player(s) can switch between the two at any time.

Most of the game is dedicated to exploring top-down areas populated by enemies, and dealing with them in action-based combat, primarily relying on magical spells. While some of the spells have unlimited use, others must be "refilled" with special items found or dropped by the enemies. Rhun and Melvy learn spells unique to each character, of various elemental affinities and general usage (offensive, support, etc.). Money can be collected from enemies as well and then used in shops to buy items.

name: ATV Racers
description: An ATV racing game featuring anthropomorphic animals.

name: Amatsu Misora ni! Kumo no Hatate ni
description: Amatsu Misora ni!: Kumo no Hatate ni is a romantic fantasy comedy for PlayStation handhelds which originated as an adult visual novel for PC (Windows) under Amatsu Misora ni! title. PSP and PS Vita ports don't really have new content to offer, but they do have all the adult content that is available in PC version, removed. Each of the game's graphics has been tuned and adjusted to match that of PC and look better on a device the game is played on.

name: All Japan Pro Wrestling Featuring Virtua
description:
A wrestling game featuring the stars from All Japan Pro Wrestling with a bonus mode that allows you to select Virtua Fighters Jeffry and Wolf.

Sega Logistics Service announced it would end service on the arcade machines on March 31, 2017.

The worst seven students are forced to take part in a studying camp called Suzunone Trial. They take exams and they will be dismissed from school if they fail. It's time to decide the worst seven again...

The included aircraft are: Cessna Skyhawk 172P, 172R, CitationJet 525, Beechcraft Bonanza V35, Baron B58, and Super King Air B200.

name: Petunia the Yellow Mouse

name: Rhythm Thief & the Paris Caper

name: Power Factor
description:
Power Factor is a 1993 side-scrolling action-platform video game developed by Hand Made Software and published by Atari Corporation in North America and Europe exclusively for the Atari Lynx. Based around a video game within a video game concept, players take control of a character who is in turn playing on a virtual reality simulator assuming the role of Redd Ace, which is recreating his battle against the Sinlendo Techmods by recovering necessary bomb components to defeat the alien race at the Ceegraian Power Station. Its gameplay consists of platforming, exploration and weapons-based combat with a main four-button configuration.

Power Factor originally began as a project intended for the Atari ST that was in development by Red Rat Software under the title Red Ace, which was nearly completed before being left unpublished due to internal issues at the company and its eventual disbandment prior to release, however Hand Made Software would later develop a conversion to the Lynx.

Power Factor has been met with positive reception from critics and reviewers since its initial release, who praised various aspects of the title such as the unique storyline, graphics and character animation but many felt divided in regards to the sound design and gameplay. In 2005, a ROM image of the original ST version was leaked online.

This game uses a similar gameplay to the original Game Boy title, with a few quality of life improvements and new additions. Random encounters were ditched entirely, with monsters being visible on the field much like in later SaGa games.

name: Lenna's Inception
description:
Explore a dangerous island filled with dungeons, and defeat the eight archangels to bring order to a glitched-out kingdom in this top-down Zelda-like action-adventure game. Playable in 8-bit and 32-bit pixel art styles! 
 
Features 
- Team up with a friend. Make peace with Shadow Lenna to enjoy the game in local co-op multiplayer! 
- Play again (and again). With two graphical styles, multiple endings, multiple boss forms, and procedural generation, you won’t see everything in a single playthrough! 
- Challenge yourself. Speed through the daily challenge dungeon with no sword, with only three hearts, or without taking a single hit. Show off a GIF of your playthrough on the connected leaderboard afterwards! 
- Recruit companions. Will you choose Henrietta, the free-range chicken with a vendetta, or perhaps Gourdon, the sentient pumpkin? (4 to discover)

name: Que ~Ancient Leaf no Yousei~
description:
You are Makoto, a high-school sophomore. One day, you receive a package with a virtual reality gadget that lets you experience a social networking service called Que. It just so happens that service is for girls only. As such, you create your female avatar and enter the world of an Ancient Leaf. While hiding your identity when talking to girls in virtual reality, many of your friends in real world have no idea about you, but at the same time you have an opportunity to find out more about them, things they wouldn't usually share with a guy.

The game is a typical visual novel which consists of reading through the text, which has full voice-over support for NPCs, lets you check the message log, and remove the text to see the clear background image with character sprites. Occasionally, choices are made to branch the story, and you can even select to go to different locations on the city map, both during daytime and nighttime.

According to the project's original concept by Chiyomaru Shikura, the game explores the theme of "Where is the boundary between the digitalized fictional world and the real world?" It is considered to be connected to the science adventure series, including "CHAOS;HEAD" (2008) and "STEINS;GATE" (2009), which further developed this theme.

In the spirit of Sorority Life, players will engage in a stylish and aspirational virtual world, working their way through careers paths, apartment upgrades, daily catwalks, and fashion galore. From a grungy studio to a Park Avenue penthouse, from overworked intern to successful CEO, from country bumpkin to glamour girl, City Girl will keep players coming back again and again!

name: Tsuyokiss 2gakki

name: Tsuyokiss
description:
Tsuyokiss is about the lives of a group of high school students and the often comedic events that occur around them. The protagonist is an ordinary boy named Leo Tsushima. He is secretly in love with the eldest daughter of the Kiriya Corporation, Erika Kiriya, who is also the student council president.

One day, a senior female student, Otome Kurogane, knocks out several of the main characters when they were trying to sneak into school being late. Surprisingly, it turns out that she is Leo’s beloved cousin that he had not seen for years. And she decides to move in to the same house with Leo, whose mediocre life starts to change into something a lot more exciting.

name: Skies of Glory
description: Gear up for the ultimate in multiplayer air combat! Skies of Glory takes you back to the groundbreaking aeronautics of World War II, set in the real life terrain of both Pacific and European theatres of war. Over land and sea, under realistic weather conditions, you and your friends can team up to defend a base, destroy enemy compounds and logistical resources, or show off your piloting skills in a full-force free-for-all.

name: Globulos Mania

name: Sky Gamblers: Air Supremacy
description: This game is our true first hit: it's been part of the iPad3 launch keynote and set the bar for graphics and quality at that point. It features an intense single-player campaign and heart racing online multiplayer modes.

name: Sky Gamblers: Cold War
description:
Coming on the heels of its Apple Design Award-winning predecessor, Sky Gamblers: Storm Raiders, Cold War presents the next evolution in flight-simulation games with fully re-created cities such as those in Vietnam, Korea, Afghanistan, and Siberia, realistic weather effects for a more authentic challenge, and interactive cockpits for the most hands-on experience. 
 
Weapons have been rebalanced to provide a faithful recreation of early jet history experience. The game also expands on the single player campaign providing diverse missions including classic dogfights, high altitude surveillance, and controlling laser-guided missiles. 
 
And in full Sky Gambling finesse, Cold War boasts console-quality graphics and a fully orchestrated soundtrack.

description: Legend of the Knucker-Hole is the second game to feature Jet-Book Jack. It was released on the Commodore 64 in 1984.

name: Horse Master
description: Horse Master: The Game of Horse Mastery is a horse management sim, crossed with Cronenbergian body horror.

name: Rally Poland
description: Polish Rally is the first native arcade racing game. In the game we have a 4 car models and over 170 km of nicely done tracks.

name: Phone Story
description: Phone Story is a game for smartphone devices that attempts to provoke a critical reflection on its own technological platform. Under the shiny surface of our electronic gadgets, behind its polished interface, hides the product of a troubling supply chain that stretches across the globe. Phone Story represents this process with four educational games that make the player symbolically complicit in coltan extraction in Congo, outsourced labor in China, e-waste in Pakistan and gadget consumerism in the West.

name: Sandcastle Builder
description: Browser game inspired by the comic XKCD 1190, "Time", and its associated forum thread and subculture.

name: Zettai Meikyuu Grimm: Nanatsu no Kagi to Rakuen no Otome
description: A fantasy otome game.

name: Samantha Swift and the Mystery From Atlantis
description: Sin descripción

name: El Chavo Kart
description:
El Chavo Kart is a mascot-based kart racing game, in the same vein as Konami Krazy Racers, Nicktoons Racing, Mickey's Speedway USA, Diddy Kong Racing, Crash Team Racing and the Mario Kart series. Players get to compete as characters from the series (except for Jamito and Gloria), along with tracks loosely based on locations from the animated series.

The game offers three game modes: Cups, Exhibition, and Challenges. In "Cups", the player can unlock characters, while at the end of "Challenges" scenarios and tracks are unlocked. The player can collect power-ups along the race which can be used to benefit himself and gain an advantage in the race. Tracks include series features and scenarios such as Azteca Stadium, the city of Acapulco, the Maracana Stadium in Rio de Janeiro and also Stadium TFC in Toulouse. Each track can be raced in the opposite direction, and include alternative paths, traps and obstacles. The game features local multiplayer, allowing up to four players to compete against each other simultaneously. The game features 45 trophies or achievements that can be unlocked to progress through the game.

name: PathPix
description: A grid-based puzzle game where pairs of dots must be connected via certain paths of squares, in order to form a picture at the end.

name: Microsoft Bingo
description: Microsoft Bingo is a free-to-play, microtransaction- and ad-supported bingo game that has players level up and unlock new areas as they play shared online games of bingo.

name: Jameson: The Pilot
description: A top-down space simulator with roguelike elements.

name: Age of Storm: Kingdom Under Fire Online
description: Age of Storm: Kingdom Under Fire Online is an MOBA title set in the Kingdom Under Fire universe.

name: Bubsy 3D: Bubsy Visits the James Turrell Retrospective
description: A web-based 3D experience and homage to both art and Bubsy.

name: Chaos Online
description: Chaos Online is AOS game with decent graphics and cool skills

name: Solar Warfare
description: A free to play space shooter.

name: Airport Firefighter Simulator
description: A simulation game where fires must be put out at the airport.

name: Proving Ground 2014
description: A driving simulator with multiple vehicles and tracks, and real vehicle dynamics and physics e.g. ABS, traction control, stability control, etc.

name: Clicking Bad
description: A game reminiscent of Cookie Clicker where players cook batches of Methamphetamine.

name: Fairground Simulator 2
description: Simulate famous rides in this fairground simulator.

name: Even Cowgirls Bleed
description: Twine game about a wannabe Cowgirl made by Christine Love.

name: Stellavanity: Prelude to the Destined Calamity
description: A STG from TRIS-GRAM, Stellavanity has players fight through seven increasingly difficult stages of bullet hell.

name: Santa Tracker
description: Track Santa's flight and play games in your browser and on Android.

name: Tecmo World Cup Millennium
description: Tecmo World Cup Millennium brings Tecmo's soccer franchise into the year 2000.

name: Tecmo World Cup '94
description: Tecmo World Cup heads back to arcades.

name: Tecmo World Cup '98
description: Tecmo World Cup '98 is another installment in the Tecmo World Cup series.

name: Tecmo World Cup Super Soccer
description: Tecmo World Cup Super Soccer is quite different from the similarly-named Tecmo World Cup Soccer. In this football (soccer) game players can choose between competing for the World Cup or participating in the Japanese league tournament. Only eight international teams (Brazil, Argentine, Japan, England, France, Spain, Italy, and Germany) are available. Before a match begins players can choose between three general strategies for the team - normal, offensive, or defensive. Weather conditions (normal, rain, or snow) and match length can be selected as well. The game itself is played from a third-person perspective that slightly switches between isometric and top-down depending on the situation.

name: The Tower DS
description: The Tower DS is a Nintendo DS entry in the SimTower/The Tower franchise.

name: Lara Croft: Reflections
description: Lara Croft: Reflections is a battle card game starring Tomb Raider's protagonist.

name: Sanae Challenge!
description: A platform game, you run around the map while fighting and sealing Kedamas and the locations where they spawn.

name: Bistro Boulevard
description: A restaurant simulator.

name: Cinema Tycoon 2: Movie Mania
description: Cinema Tycoon 2: Movie Mania is a cinema simulator.

name: Ikazuse! Koi no Doki Doki Penguin Land MD
description: Sin descripción

name: Dungeon Story
description: Match swords, magic, hearts and gold while battling monsters and levelling up your hero.

name: Ganbare Goemon: Sarawareta Ebisumaru!
description:
Originally released as Ganbare Goemon: Sarawareta Ebisumaru!, it is a Game Boy game released in 1991 and the first game in the Goemon series ever released for a portable system.

Gameplay is similar to Ganbare Goemon! Karakuri Douchuu which was released on the Famicom. Only Goemon is playable, and the game consists of him rescuing Ebisumaru; Sasuke and Yae do not make appearances.

name: Slingray
description: Multiplayer team-based competitive space hockey inspired by games like Uniball and Subspace

name: Chinese Zombie War
description: A Malaysian-made video game made for iOS devices.

name: NCAA March Madness 2002
description: The 2002 entry in the college basketball franchise.

name: Tekken Arena
description: Tekken Arena is a free-to-play strategy game for Android and iOs

name: Grumpy Cat: Unimpressed
description: A match-three game featuring snarky commentary from Grumpy Cat, an internet meme.

name: Boundra
description: A free-to-play, Japanese fantasy MMORPG developed by InterServ and published in Japan by Vector.

name: Grave
description: As a skeleton, armed with a sword, try to stay "alive" while battling other creatures and monsters in a cemetery. How many can you take down before being defeated?

name: Warage Card Game
description: Sin descripción

name: Namco High
description: From Homestuck creator Andrew Hussie and universally-acclaimed video game developer Namco Bandai Games comes an all new gaming experience: Namco High! As a cousin to the Prince from Katamari Damacy, you will meet total strangers with whom you have nothing in common, but before the school year is over you'll break rules, bare your soul, and touch each other in ways you never dreamed.

name: AstroHawk
description: Astrohawk is a SNES homebrew developed by Paul Lay from Playsoft, the game was originally developed in the 90's but it was until 2014 that was published in cartridge.

name: Championship Mah Jongg
description: Championship Mah Jongg

name: The Squared Circle
description: Four games including Wrestling Encore, Booking Encore, Grass Roots, and World War Alpha.

name: Nintendo 3DS Guide: Louvre
description: Educational software available for Nintendo 3DS. This is an enhanced standalone version of the audio guide visitors of the Louvre can rent on location.

name: National Lampoon's University Tycoon
description: A Simulation game about being in a university.

name: Bedlam 2: Absolute Bedlam
description: The sequel to the 1996 isometric shooter Bedlam, yet again tasking Major Kern with killing hordes of robots.

name: I Spy Game Pack
description: A two pack game on one disc. Ultimate I Spy and I spy Spooky Mansion

name: Star Wars: Attack Squadrons
description: Star Wars: Attack Squadrons was an online browser-based space combat game in development by Disney Interactive and Area 52 Games.

name: Illusion - Ghost Killer
description: Set up six cameras in strategic positions to capture the elusive Jeff the Killer on film.

name: Irem Arcade Hits
description: 18 classic Irem arcade games for PC and Mac.

name: Action Arcade Wrestling 2
description: The sequel to the original Action Arcade Wrestling game adds the ability to edit/create wrestlers from the players PC then import them into the game.

name: Action Arcade Wrestling
description:
Action Arcade Wrestling is as the title suggests a arcade style wrestling game that allows the player to customize his wrestler by adjusting the size, outfit and hair, with the colour of the outfits and hair being adjustable. Players can also assign various moves to their wrestler.

To fight bouts, the player can choose from one out of a total of ten arenas, all of which are also customisable by the player. The game modes on offer include Tag Team, Rumble, Championship and Tag Championship.

Action Arcade Wrestling also supports multiplayer for up to four people on a single console for one on one bouts, or tag team games.

name: Federation Booker
description: Control your own wrestling federation as well as play in the matches.

name: Rofaxan 2089 AD
description: Rofaxan 2089 AD is a space shooter for Xbox 360 and PC

name: Football Manager Handheld 2014
description: Sports Interactive and Sega's annual mobile management simulation for the 2013-2014 season.

name: AtWar
description: AtWar is a turn based strategy game that compiles the best of Risk and Civilization in a free-moving, domination style browser game.

name: Imagine Nations
description: Imagine Nations is a voxel-based sandbox game where players can choose from a wide range of features to build their perfect game style.

name: Streemerz
description: Streemerz is an 8-bit retro platformer by Arthur Lee for his Action 52 Owns project. First created as a freeware PC game, it was "demade" for the Nintendo Entertainment System.

name: Dream C Club Gogo
description: A new entry in the hostess dating sim.

name: HeroWarz
description:
HeroWarz is the Ultimate action RPG where you select and cultivate unique heroes to build your own personal assault force. Get ready for the most addicting, fast-paced, action-packed online gaming experience!

The Korean servers were shutdown in October 2017.
The game was released briefly in North America through KOG Games before being shutdown in Match 2017.
The game had releases planned in Japan through Sega and in China through NetEase but both versions were shutdown before a public release.

In 2019, NetEase working with A.Storm announced a remake titled NightMare Breaker, 超激斗梦境, in China using the same characters with better graphics but slower gameplay.
In 2022, the remake was announced with a 2023 release date in Korea through Nexon under the title Night Walker.

name: Deer Hunter 2014
description: Glu Mobile's Deer Hunter release for the 2014 season.

name: Miko Gakkou Monogatari: Sanae Episode
description: A doujin visual novel available in English.

name: Tsuppari Oozumou: Heisei-han
description: An enhanced re-release of the 1987 Tsuppari Oozumou game for Famicom.

name: Pirates of the Caribbean: Isles Of War
description: Sin descripción

name: Monster Madness Online
description: A free-to-play, online shooter with RPG elements, featuring both 4-player campaign co-op and 16-player competitive modes. Developed by Dungeon Defenders maker Trendy Entertainment and their subsidiary studio Nom Nom Games.

name: The Battles of King Arthur
description: The Battles of King Arthur is a strategy game by Excalibur Publishing.

name: Fjords
description: Fjords is a pizza-delivery adventure game set in a world made of science.

name: Moonlight Lady
description: An adventure game with animated cutscenes and action-RPG sequences, starring three cutesy anime girls.

name: Komocchi
description: Raise a cute cartoon avatar, playing mini-games to increase its skills.

name: Tsuki no Hikari: Shizumeru Kane no Satsujin
description: Sin descripción

name: Fish Face
description: In Fish Face, players control a fish with a human face who tries to rescue the Cephalapod Princess.

name: Action Fist
description: Action Fist is a side-scrolling game created in the style of mid-90s platform shooters. It was mostly inspired by Gunstar Heroes.

name: 0Space
description: Inspired by “Ender's Game” by Orson Scott Card, 0Space is a small 2-4 player zero gravity death-match game.

name: Aqua Paradise: Boku no Suizokukan
description: As implied by the subtitle, "My Aquarium", this Japan-only PlayStation game lets the player manage a public aquarium stuffed to the gills with sea animals.

name: Akagawa Jirou: Yasoukyoku
description: A visual novel adapted from the book Yasoukyoku ("Nocturne") by Jirou Akagawa, which contains two murder mysteries.

description: Sin descripción

name: Tall Twins Tower
description: Sin descripción

name: The Collectables
description: The Collectables is a free to play shooter game by Crytek.

name: Foiled
description:
A competitive local multiplayer game created by Gabe Cuzillo and Aaron Taecker-Wyss. 
The object is to kill the opponent, catch his soul and score a point by bringing it to the designated area. The player has to score 3 times to win the round in a best of 3.

name: Project Ion
description:
Project Ion is an MMOFPS/TPS/RPG that is in development since late 2011.
The project is under constant development but has a playable version up all the time.

name: Legends of Ith
description: Who is Ith you may ask, not much is known but one thing is certain if Ith doesn't collect 64 skulls Ith will be trapped forever in the depth of what is the Legends Of Ith.

name: Super Mega Extreme Cyber Ortek Flier 2005 X
description: Also known as "SMECOF2005X" for short. A side-scrolling shooter game by Fig Hunter.

name: Galactic Princess
description: Superficially looking like a cross between the graphical style of Superbrothers Sword & Sworcery EP, the plot of the first Star Wars movie and the gameplay of FTL, mixed with Elite style trading.

name: Game Doraemon: Nobita to Kiseki no Shima
description: Doraemon: Nobita to Kiseki no Shima is a 3D action game for the Nintendo 3DS

name: Super Brawl 3: Just Got Real
description: The characters of Nickelodeon's most popular series go head-to-head with a more realistic flavor.

name: Initial D: Takahashi Ryosuke no Typing Saisoku Riron
description:
The PlayStation 2 port of the game, originally released for Windows and Mac.
It is a typing tutor game based on the Initial D anime that requires a USB keyboard to play.

name: Initial D: Second Stage Typing Game
description: Initial D: Second Stage Typing Game is typing tutorial game for Windows and Macintosh, based on the Initial D driving anime.

name: Initial D Gaiden
description:
Initial D Gaiden is the first video game in the Initial D series for Game Boy.
The game was only released in Japan.

name: Mahjong Taikai Wii
description: A Japanese import of the classic Mahjong board game.

name: Mahjong Taikai II Special
description: Mahjong Taikai II Special is a multiplatform upgrade to the SNES entry "Mahjong Taikai II".

name: Mahjong Taikai III
description: Mahjong Taikai III is the PlayStation 2 entry in Koei's mahjong series.

name: Space Galaga
description: Namco-Bandai mixes classic Galaga action with the anime Space Dandy.

name: Xrodon
description: Indie RPG game in a magical/fantasy setting.

name: Agents of Storm
description: Agents of Storm is a free-to-play strategy and base management game set in the South Seas with a tropical environment. Similar to games like Clash of Clans the goal is to gather resources to construct and upgrade buildings, and acquire various units to conquer the surrounding environment.

name: Legend of the Unicorn Girl
description: A fast-based 2D side-scrolling platformer.

name: Brilliant Hamsters!
description: A hamster pet simulator for the 3DS

name: Tome: Immortal Arena
description: Tome: Immortal Arena is a brawler MOBA built for non-stop action.

name: Freeq
description: An audio-focused game for iOS in which players are a futuristic switchboard operator.

name: Valkyrie Crusade
description: An addictive Free-To-Play collectible card battle game with town-building elements for mobile devices

name: Fire Escape
description: Trapped inside a towering inferno you play as Terry Bristles, the fearless, firefighting moustachioed hero, as he attempts to escape in the only direction he can -- up!

name: FarmFury!
description: FarmFury! is a multiplayer farm simulation game where anime-style farmers try to sabotage each other.

name: Jantaku Boy
description: Jantaku Boy is a mahjong game from Namco.

name: Keyboardmania II: 2ndMix and 3rdMix
description: Keyboardmania II combines the second and third arcade releases of the Keyboardmania series.

name: Keyboardmania 2ndMix
description: Keyboardmania 2ndMix is the second arcade release in the Keyboardmania series. Unlike KEYBOARDMANIA, all the songs in KEYBOARDMANIA 2ndMIX have song comments on the official website for the game. LIGHT difficulty is introduced, which is a more simple difficulty that only uses 13 keys instead of 24. NORMAL is renamed LIGHT+. PRESSURE mode is introduced, which consists of four song courses. The gauge starts at 100%, but does not recover from any MISSes, even between songs. Videos for returning KEYBOARDMANIA songs were changed to generic videos that use various KEYBOARMANIA song clips.

name: Silver Ghost
description: A unique hybrid RTS/Action/RPG game first released in 1988. It was the first game by Kure Software Koubou and itnroduced their eventually popular Multiple Character gameplay system that they went on to use in many later games.

name: The Scheme
description: The Scheme is an action RPG released by Bothtec (later known as Quest) for the PC-88 in 1988. It features Metroidvania-style open-world exploration, side-scrolling run & gun shooter combat, and chiptune music by Yuzo Koshiro.

name: Xanadu Scenario II
description: One of the first examples of an expansion pack, this was an additional scenario disk for the action role-playing game Xanadu: Dragon Slayer II.

name: Euphory
description: Side-scrolling, Metroidvania-style, action RPG, released by System Sacom in 1987.

name: Sheared
description: Sheared is a action packed, crafty game for players of all ages.

name: Hover Attack
description: An early run & gun shooter released for Japanese computers in 1984.

name: To Love-Ru Darkness: Battle Ecstasy
description: To Love-Ru Darkness: Battle Ecstasy is an "Ultra Harem Action" PS Vita game developed by Furyu in May 22, 2014. The genre is consistently made up of four parts: Play-through Action, My Room, Communication, and Adventure.

name: J.B. Harold no Jikenbo #2: Manhattan Requiem
description:
A sequel to the original J.B. Harold no Jikenbo.

24 year old pianist Sarah Shields was found dead after falling from the 25th floor of her apartment window. The cause of death was a fractured skull from the horrific impact. With no evidence of foul play, an act of suicide was the best explanation - but J.B. Harold thinks otherwise. Having recieved a letter from Sarah beforehand, the famous detective heads towards New York city to find the truth.

name: Second Person Shooter Zato
description: An experimental 'second-person shooter' released by Japanese indie developer, Himo, in 2011.

name: SeeNa
description: First-person action game, published by SystemSoft for Japanese computers in 1986. Its polygonal 3D graphics engine was a technical milestone, rendering 3D environments at a fast pace and (compared to the tile-based, right-angle movement of earlier first-person games) allowed the player to move with full 360-degree movement.

name: Crion World
description: Crion World is a 3D RPG which takes a place in Crion's Valley at the beginning of a medieval ages. Game starts when first dragon was born in Crion World. You're chosen to make a peace on this land and burn creatures to ashes.

name: Nicole
description: Nicole is a dating sim that revolves around your day-to-day life as a college student. You can take up part-time jobs to earn money, explore various locations, do recreational and extra-curricular activities, and meet intriguing characters like Darren, Kurt, Jeff and Ted. You might even get to date the culprit!

name: Dimensional Fighter Epsilon3
description: An early 3D, first-person, role-playing shooter, released by Bullet-Proof Software in 1985. Ahead of its time, it was an early example of both the Action-RPG and FPS genres.

name: Knight Arms
description: Knight Arms: The Hybrid Framer was part third-person rail shooter and part side-scrolling platformer, released by Arsys Software for the Sharp X68000 computer in 1989. It featured some of the most advanced pseudo-3D sprite-scaling seen on a home system of the 1980's.

name: Jissen Pachi-Slot Pachinko Hisshouhou! Wii: Hokuto no Ken - Sammy's Collection
description: Jissen Pachi-Slot Pachinko Hisshouhou! Wii: Hokuto no Ken - Sammy's Collection is a compilation of Fist of the North Star-themed pachi-slot games for Wii.

name: Tae Bo Girl Dress Up
description: Dress up game starring a fitness junkie.

name: Kizuchida Quiz da Gen-San Da!
description: A quiz game starring the protagonist of the Hammerin' Harry/Gen-San games.

name: Noobow
description:
Noobow is a puzzle platformer featuring a Japanese chocolate mascot. The aim of the game is to pick up objects and use them wherever they're needed in order to stop the sun and rain from fighting each other. After using the objects in the right places they disappear to confirm that players have made the right choice.

There are 7 levels in the game and Noobow will always refuse to put his life in danger. Completing each level is done by reaching the goal and assisting the characters that are waiting there.

name: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire - Panem Run
description: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire - Panem Run is an endless runner based on The Hunger Games: Catching Fire.

name: Cloudface
description: A short platforming game in development with lovely sound and visuals.

name: Kidou Senshi Gundam Part 1: Gundam Daishi ni Tatsu
description: Kidou Senshi Gundam Part 1: Gundam Daishi ni Tatsu!! (機動戦士ガンダム PART 1 ガンダム大地に立つ！！ "Mobile Suit Gundam Part 1: Gundam Stands on the Ground!!") is an adventure/shooter/RPG from 1983, based on the popular Mobile Suit Gundam anime television series.

name: Big Buck Hunter Pro
description: Big Buck Hunter PRO is a new species of hunting game that delivers a hot new quarry of no-limit fun to players everywhere. The premise is simple; There are 4 areas with 5 rounds in each one. Each round has 3 bucks to take down with your shotgun, but watch out for those doe's, other wise the round is over

name: Kidou Senshi Gundam Part 2: Tobe Gundam
description: Kidou Senshi Gundam Part 2: Tobe! Gundam (機動戦士ガンダム PART 2 翔べ！ガンダム "Mobile Suit Gundam Part 2: Fly! Gundam") is an adventure/shooter/RPG from 1984, based on the Mobile Suit Gundam anime series. It anticipated several gameplay elements later found in FPS, TPS and action RPG games.

name: Pac-Chomp!
description: Pac-Chomp! is a match three game starring Pac-Man

name: Will: The Death Trap II
description: Will: The Death Trap II is a video game developed and published by Squaresoft in 1985, for the NEC PC-8801, NEC PC-9801, Fujitsu FM-7 and Sharp X1 computers. Developed by Hironobu Sakaguchi, the game was a technical milestone for its real-time animated cutscenes, rendered using animated bitmap graphics, as well as its soundtrack by Nobuo Uematsu.

name: Pingu: Sekai de Ichiban Genki na Penguin
description: Pingu : Sekai de ichiban genki na penguin is an Action game, developed by Tom Create and published by B.I., which was released in Japan in 1993.

name: Shufflepuck Cantina Deluxe
description: Shufflepuck Cantina Deluxe is an air hockey game.

name: Trooper Truck
description: A side-scrolling action game released for the Commodore 64 in 1983.

name: Star Cruiser II: The Odysseus Project
description: The Odysseus Project is a follow-up to Star Cruiser. Gameplay concept and visual style are very similar to that of the predecessor: it is a first-person 3D shooter with extensive exploration and customization elements, which grants it a light role-playing angle. Much of the game is spent on planet surfaces, in populated or hostile areas. Combat is action-based by default, but there is an option for a menu-based combat as well. There is a variety of weapons, armor, gadgets, and items to find or purchase. It is also possible to physically navigate a spaceship. Combat in space plays similarly to on-foot battles, with the additional of a freely rotatable camera.

name: Oel
description: A Commodore 64 text-based multiplayer strategy game in which the players are tasked with creating their own oil company.

name: Favela Wars
description: War for drug territory is raging in Rio de Janeiro between Police and Dealers. Neither will be satisfied until the last slum is occupied. Choose your side, plot your strategy, and challenge your friends! A turn-based strategy game like you've never seen before!

name: Tiny Plane
description: Move your tiny plane up and down collecting fruit and coins along the way.

name: The Earth Fighter Rayieza
description: The Earth Fighter Rayieza is a role-playing game.

name: Genesis: Beyond the Revelation
description: Squaresoft's first RPG, this was an early futuristic sci-fi RPG for the PC-8801 and PC-9801 computers, featuring a post-apocalyptic setting and isometric, tactical turn-based battles.

name: The Screamer
description: The Screamer is a 1985 cyberpunk-horror action RPG taking place in a post-apocalyptic, sci-fi setting. It was released by Magical Zoo, for the PC-8801 in 1985 and for the PC-9801 and X1 in 1986. An English fan translation was released in January 2015.

name: Savaki
description: Sin descripción

name: Astro Wars II: Battle in Galaxy
description: Astro Wars II: Battle in Galaxy is the follow-up to Super Cassette Vision's previous space shooter.

name: Astro Wars: Invader From Space
description: Astro Wars (subtitled Invader From Space on the title screen) is a space shooter for the Super Cassette Vision.

name: Kung Fu Road
description: Kung Fu Road is a side-scrolling single-plane brawler for Super Cassette Vision.

name: Cosmic Soldier 2: Psychic War
description: Action RPG sequel to Cosmic Soldier, released for Japanese computers in 1987 and for North American PC in 1989.

name: Sora no Otoshimono Forte: Dreamy Season
description: Sin descripción

name: Nekketsu Kouha Kunio-kun TD
description: Those hot-blooded yanki are back in an epic 8-bit styled Tower Defense game.

name: Dark Blood
description: Dark Blood is side-scrolling action game.

name: Kingdom Online
description: Kingdom Online is in the Knight Online series.

name: Akane Maniax ~Nagareboshi Densetsu Gouda~
description: It's love at first sight as brash transfer student Jouji Gouda sets out to win the heart of Akane Suzumiya in this comedic spin-off from Kimi ga Nozomu Eien.

name: Slender Man: Chapter 2 - Survive
description: Slender Man is back in this all new sequel to the indie mobile hit game Slender Man - Chapter 1: Alone. Can you stand the suspense as Slender Man stalks you through 3 all new terrifying, 3D levels? He got some new surprises in store that are sure to make you scream. Beware, this is not an easy game.

name: Jarokn Tic-Tac-Toe Club
description: A tic-tac-toe game with the ability to start your own club.

name: Strike Fighters 2
description: Combat flight sim focusing on the early jet age, when aviation technology was still primitive but advancing rapidly, this game, along with its many standalone expansions (that can be combined into one game), encompasses the range of air combat from the mid-1950s to the late 1970s (and beyond with mods).

name: Cyphers
description: Cyphers is a Korean, third-person MOBA style Action Game where two teams try to take down a series of barricades and towers to destroy the enemy's main building and claim victory. The game has a strong emphasis on melee weapons and stylish attacks. Players may choose from a variety of 35 characters. It also has a unique progression system where the player's level depends on the number of upgrades they have.

name: Odyssey RPG
description: A mobile deck-building RPG inspired by the myths of ancient Greece, published by R2Games.

name: Hench: The Mix Master
description: Hench: The Mix Master is an MMORPG that features lots of pets.

name: WonderKing 2
description: This is a 2D side-scrolling cute MMORPG similar to Maple Story.

name: Dream Raiders
description: A two player arcade shooter from Sega that features motion seats and fans to simulate wind.

name: Sqrxz III
description: Sqrxz must rescue his girlfriend from the forces of evil in this third outing from Retroguru.

name: Fila Decathlon
description: Fila Decathlon is a track-and-field game with branding from the world-famous sports equipment and apparel manufacturer.

name: Sqrxz 2
description: Sqrxz 2 brings more bunny-hopping action to multiple platforms (and ditches those ridiculous exclamation points to boot).

name: !Sqrxz!
description: !Sqrxz! is a 1996 platforming game starring an undefinable creature.

name: Maluch Racer 3
description: The last game in the Maluch Racer trilogy. Released in 2010.

name: Battle Tiers Invasion
description: Battle Tiers Invasion is a shooter game by timesymmetry.

name: Oretachi ni Tsubasa wa Nai - Under the Innocent Sky
description:
This might just be a "what if" but, 
 
A certain day, Gretagard's pure white sky was overrun by winged ones. 
 
Now, the sky extends just about anywhere and everywhere, right? 
 
So no matter how far you run, you can't escape those white wings of theirs. 
 
And that's why the people without wings went looking for a sky of their own. 
 
Their prayers were listened, and they are now listening to "Jingle Bells" in a calm country--- 
 
This might just be a "what if" but, 
What we will tell you about now, is such a fairy-tale.

Retro arcade action game featuring unique levels to explore, puzzles to solve and bosses to battle! Special powerups lets you upgrade your weapons systems to battle the robotic enemies! Go for all the silver discs in four exciting levels: Electron Alley, Futile Resistor, Decompression Sector and Superconductor Challenge.
